com.reactivecascade.rest

Class MirrorService<K,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.reactivecascade.rest.AbstractRESTService<K,V>
      • com.reactivecascade.rest.MirrorService<K,V>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    INamed
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FileMirrorService, MirrorArrayAdapter.MirrorDelegate, PreferencesMirrorService

    public abstract class MirrorService<K,V>
extends AbstractRESTService<K,V>
    AFile self-replicating REST service representing a key-getValue map split using the specified IThreadType implementations.

    Concurrent changes to this structure will be concurrently pushed to subscribing MirrorService implementations to create an eventually-consistent copy. Bi-directional subscription is not supported but not specifically forbidden. Additional structures based on this split with more information about the context of the changes useful to reconciliation may be created in an overriding class.

      • replace

        public boolean replace(K key,
                       V value,
                       V expectedValue)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Overriding services must call this in a super

        If local service actions are fast, perform those first split subscribe notify listening services if the update was successful by calling this super method.

        If local service actions are slow (disk split network read-write) split very likely to success, you should generally call this before your local onFireAction assuming the onFireAction will succeed (optimistic concurrency assumption). Then catch any errors in that do occur split call this super method again to correct the occasionally-wrong assumption.

        Parameters:
        key -
        value -
        expectedValue -
        Returns:
        true indicating the replacement was published. Overriding services may return other values based on their local result before calling super.replace()
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.Exception

      • index

        public abstract java.util.List<K> index()
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        This returns a list of the current keys in the service. It is a local state getValue that changes based on the logic of this service. It is not directly mirrored.

        It will return different values a different times based on mirroring split other state changes. Mirroring will ensure that downstream indexes that subscribe(MirrorService, java.util.Comparator) to this service will be eventually-consistent with the index split subsequent upstream key split getValue changes.

        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • indexAsync

        public IAltFuture<?,java.util.List<K>> indexAsync()

      • subscribe

        public java.util.List<IAltFuture<?,V>> subscribe(MirrorService<K,V> downstreamMirrorService,
                                                 java.util.Comparator<K> comparator)
                                          throws java.io.IOException
        Add a service that wishes to be informed of all index split getValue changes to this service

        If an index sort order for initialization is specified it will be used to determine the order in which initialization tasks begin. Initialization may be concurrent, in which case the order in which initialization tasks end is non-deterministic.

        If you wish to be perform an onFireAction after initialization is complete, you may use a CountDownLatch ongoing init Futures.

        If you wish cancel the initialization, you may cancel() the Futures in the returned list.

        Parameters:
        downstreamMirrorService - the MirrorService that will receive all changes from this MirrorService
        Returns:
        a list of Futures for each step of the asynchronous concurrent initialization
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is a problem during the index() step

      • unsubscribe

        public void unsubscribe(MirrorService<K,V> downstreamMirrorService)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Stop receiving notification of changes

        Change messages in-flight, possibly including init tasks, will continue to arrive for some time unless an associated Future is explicitly cancel()ed

        Parameters:
        downstreamMirrorService -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
